title: Hove Festival Tip: JJ
content:
Little is known about Swedish dream-pop outfit jj, no myspace, few photographs and even fewer interviews, yet last year they still managed to kick up a tornado of fuss on the blogosphere when they released debut album jj n° 2. Having received top ratings from Pitchfork, jj are destined for further fame, despite their seeming disinterest in the glamour and glory of it. Apart from releasing two albums, titled jj n° 2 and jj n° 3 respectively, they have also given away several songs for free download, including a cover of Akon’s Troublemaker.

Having already toured Europe and the US as support for The XX, and claiming thousands of new fans on the way, jj bring their melancholic pop to Hove Festival in Norway. Signed to Secretly Canadian, a fast growing independent record label which has also harboured releases from Animal Collective, Here We Go Magic and Yeasayer, to name but a few. Expect a moving and emotional set, filled with stunning female vocals, and simple but effective instrumental pieces. Despite have no hits as such, listen out for career highlights to date Things Will Never Be The Same Again and Ecstasy, if you are lucky enough to catch their set on the Marquee Stage.

Listen To Things Will Never Be The Same Again
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
